summary.text: Override this static method in order for the loader to validate the options provided to the module provider.
You can use the
`constructor`

of the provider's service to access resources in your module's container.

You can also use the constructor to initialize your integration with the third-party provider. For example, if you use a client to connect to the third-party providerâ€™s APIs,
you can initialize it in the constructor and use it in other methods in the service.

The provider can also access the module's options as a second parameter.
The module's container used to resolve resources.
The options passed to the payment module provider.
The module's container used to resolve resources.
The options passed to the payment module provider.
Each payment provider has a unique identifier defined in its class.

This method is used to capture a payment. The payment is captured in one of the following scenarios:

- The
authorizePayment
method returns the status
`captured`

, which automatically executed this method after authorization.
- The merchant requests to capture the payment after its associated payment session was authorized.
- A webhook event occurred that instructs the payment provider to capture the payment session. Learn more about handing webhook events in [this guide](https://docs.medusajs.com/v2/resources/commerce-modules/payment/webhook-events).

In this method, use the third-party provider to capture the payment.

content.text: The new data to store in the payment's
`data`
property, or an error object.

summary.text: The
`data`

property of the payment. Make sure to store in it
any helpful identification for your third-party integration.

This method authorizes a payment session. When authorized successfully, a payment is created by the Payment
Module which can be later captured using the
capturePayment

method.

Refer to [this guide](https://docs.medusajs.com/v2/resources/commerce-modules/payment/payment-flow#3-authorize-payment-session)
to learn more about how this fits into the payment flow and how to handle required actions.

To automatically capture the payment after authorization, return the status
`captured`

content.text: Either an object of the new data to store in the created payment's
`data`

property and the
payment's status, or an error object. Make sure to set in
`data`
anything useful to later retrieve the session.

summary.text: The
`data`

property of the payment session. Make sure to store in it
any helpful identification for your third-party integration.

The context in which the payment is being authorized. For example, in checkout,
the context has a
`cart_id`
property indicating the ID of the associated cart.
The new status of the payment.
The data to store in the created payment's
`data`
property.
This method cancels a payment.

content.text: An error object if an error occurs, or the data received from the integration.

summary.text: The
`data`

property of the payment. Make sure to store in it
any helpful identification for your third-party integration.

This method is used when a payment session is created. It can be used to initiate the payment
in the third-party session, before authorizing or capturing the payment later.

content.text: An object whose
`data`

property is set in the created payment session, or an error
object. Make sure to set in
`data`
anything useful to later retrieve the session.

summary.text: The details of the payment session and its context.

This method is used when a payment session is deleted, which can only happen if it isn't authorized, yet.

Use this to delete or cancel the payment in the third-party service.

content.text: An error object or the response from the third-party service.

summary.text: The
`data`

property of the payment session. Make sure to store in it
any helpful identification for your third-party integration.
This method gets the status of a payment session based on the status in the third-party integration.

content.text: The payment session's status.

summary.text: The
`data`

property of the payment session. Make sure to store in it
any helpful identification for your third-party integration.
This method refunds an amount of a payment previously captured.

content.text: The new data to store in the payment's
`data`
property, or an error object.

summary.text: The
`data`

property of the payment. Make sure to store in it
any helpful identification for your third-party integration.
The amount to refund.
Retrieves the payment's data from the third-party service.

content.text: An object to be stored in the payment's
`data`
property, or an error object.

summary.text: The
`data`

property of the payment. Make sure to store in it
any helpful identification for your third-party integration.
Update a payment in the third-party service that was previously initiated with the
initiatePayment
method.

content.text: An object whose
`data`

property is set in the updated payment session, or an error
object. Make sure to set in
`data`
anything useful to later retrieve the session.

summary.text: The details of the payment session and its context.

This method is executed when a webhook event is received from the third-party payment provider. Use it
to process the action of the payment provider.

Learn more in [this documentation](https://docs.medusajs.com/v2/resources/commerce-modules/payment/webhook-events)

content.text: The webhook result. If the
`action`
's value is
`captured`

, the payment is captured within Medusa as well.
If the
`action`
's value is
`authorized`
, the associated payment session is authorized within Medusa.

summary.text: The webhook event's data
The parsed webhook body.
The raw webhook request body.
The headers of the webhook request.
